name: Emulate AWS SNS locally in PHP.txt - Run (Docker Version)
description: This section provides instructions for running a Docker container that emulates the AWS SNS (Simple Notification Service) locally on your machine. It allows developers to test and debug their applications that integrate with AWS SNS without incurring any costs or relying on the actual AWS service. The instructions involve pulling a pre-built Docker image and running a container based on that image, which exposes the emulated SNS service on port 4100.
use_cases: Testing applications that integrate with AWS SNS
Developing and experimenting with AWS SNS functionality without incurring costs
Simulating AWS SNS behavior in a controlled environment

name: Emulate AWS SNS locally in PHP.txt - Setup AWS CLI to connect to the AWS server
description: This section provides instructions on how to configure the AWS Command Line Interface (CLI) tool to connect to the AWS server. It guides the user through entering their AWS Access Key ID, AWS Secret Access Key, preferred AWS region, and output format. This process is necessary to authenticate and interact with AWS services from the command line.
use_cases: Accessing AWS services from the command line
Testing and debugging AWS applications locally

name: Emulate AWS SNS locally in PHP.txt - Integration in PHP Code
description: This section demonstrates how to integrate the AWS SDK for PHP into a PHP application to interact with the Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) locally. It involves configuring the AWS SDK with specific settings, such as the endpoint URL, timeout values, region, version, and credentials. This allows developers to emulate and test the SNS functionality without relying on the actual AWS infrastructure during development or testing phases.
use_cases: Local development and testing of applications that utilize AWS SNS
Simulating AWS SNS functionality in a controlled environment
Debugging and troubleshooting issues related to AWS SNS integration
Facilitating continuous integration and deployment workflows

name: Emulate AWS SNS locally in PHP.txt - Common CLI Commands
description: This section provides common command-line interface (CLI) commands for interacting with Amazon Web Services (AWS) Simple Notification Service (SNS) and Simple Queue Service (SQS) locally using a local endpoint. It allows developers to create queues, list subscriptions and topics, create topics, and subscribe a queue to a topic without using the actual AWS services, which can be useful for testing and development purposes.
use_cases: Testing and development of applications that use AWS SNS and SQS
Simulating AWS SNS and SQS functionality locally
Learning and experimenting with AWS SNS and SQS commands
Debugging and troubleshooting issues related to AWS SNS and SQS
